text: So, what is to desire in French, to desire?
Désirer.
How would you say you desire?
Vous désirez.
Turn it into a question by raising your intonation at the end.
Vous désirez?
A typical way to be asked what it is you want, perhaps to drink or to eat.
How would you say do you desire to take a coffee?
Désirez-vous prendre un café?
Say yes, two coffees and the bill, please.
Oui, deux cafés et l'addition, s'il vous plaît.
Again, what is to pay in French?
Payer.
And if you want to issue that as an order, it's exactly the same.
It's spelt with a Z on the end, but it sounds exactly the same as to pay.
So, issue an order and say pay.
Payer.
What is to keep in French?
Garder.
So, how would you say keep?
Garder.
What was the change in French?
La monnaie.
Keep the change.
Garder la monnaie.
How would you say a bottle of white wine in French?
Une bouteille de vin blanc.
How would you say I want a bottle of white wine?
I want a bottle of white wine.
Je veux une bouteille de vin blanc.
What would you call a bottle of red wine?
Une bouteille de vin rouge.
And what is a sandwich?
Un sandwich.
Un sandwich.
How would you say he wants a bottle of red wine and a sandwich?
Elle veut une bouteille de vin rouge et un sandwich.
How would you say she wants a bottle of white wine and the dish of the day?
Elle veut une bouteille de vin blanc.
What is to take in French?
Prendre.
How would you say I can take?
Je peux prendre.
I can take a taxi.
Je peux prendre un taxi.
And what's the word for here?
Ici.
How would you say I can't take a taxi here?
Je ne peux pas prendre un taxi ici.
What is the word for where in French?
Where?
Où.
How would you say where is it that?
Où est-ce que?
How would you say where is it that I can take a taxi?
Où est-ce que je peux prendre un taxi?
So again, what is it is in French it is?
C'est.
How would you say it's for me?
C'est pour moi.
How would you say it's for this evening?
C'est pour ce soir.
Use a rising intonation and say it's for this evening.
C'est pour ce soir.
Reply yes for six o'clock.
Oui, pour six heures.
How would you say I have reserved a table for six o'clock?
J'ai réservé une table pour six heures.
We have reserved a table for six o'clock.
Nous avons réservé une table pour six heures.
What are the toilets in French?
The toilets.
Les toilettes.
And how would you say where are the toilets?
Où sont les toilettes?
Say the toilets are here.
Les toilettes sont ici.
Les toilettes.
Thank you.
